intro: Guilandina delphinensis, commonly known as the blue-flowered climbing vine, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its long, trailing stems and striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Leguminosae (Fabaceae) family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing species. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Guilandina delphinensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various growing conditions.
